Thank you for you review comments @fpvandoorn. 

`Option.ne_none_iff_exists` does not seem to be in Mathlib. Where should I put the new lemma you're asking for?
I would add the `Iff.not` versions of `WithBot.ne_bot_iff_exists` and `Option.ne_none_iff_exists` just below the existing versions (for `Option` it can live in `Data/Option/Basic`.

I should have addressed all the comments and suggestions.

Thank you @fpvandoorn for your review!

I should have addressed all the comments and suggestions.

Thank you @fpvandoorn for your review!

:v: pitmonticone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9779225130/job/26997946245)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9779225130/job/26997945553)

Can you add a version with `\ne` instead of `<`, on `Option \a`?
Note that that is roughly a negated version of [`Option.ne_none_iff_exists`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Data/Option/Lemmas.html#Option.ne_none_iff_exists)

Also, this name should contain `lt`, e.g. `forall_lt_iff_eq_bot`
I'm not at all sure how to proceed here.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion lemma forall_lt_iff_eq_bot [Preorder α] {x : WithBot α} : ```

This is now very short with `eq_bot_iff_forall`, right?
Something like (untested) `exact eq_top_iff_forall.mpr (fun x \mapsto (h x).ne')`
Maybe it would also be nice to unformize whether `x = ⊥` is LHS or RHS, but I don't have a strong opinion there.

Done. Thanks. 

> Maybe it would also be nice to unformize whether x = ⊥ is LHS or RHS, but I don't have a strong opinion there.

I have a weak opinion for enforcing `x = ⊥` on the RHS since it is simpler.

```suggestion
lemma forall_ne_iff_eq_none {o : Option α} : (∀ (x : α), some x ≠ o) ↔ o = none := by
```
(or perhaps `forall_some_ne_iff_eq_none`). Similar in the other new `ne` lemmas.

Thanks!

bors d+
Ops, you're right. Sorry. I'll do it later.
